page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION,CORSHAM
page.content: The D-block area includes most of the town of Corsham as well as the villages of Rudloe and Neston. Rudloe is largely residential with few facilities. Most of the people who live there work in the Forces or the Civil Service. Neston is also largely residential but has more of a village atmosphere. Corsham itself has a population of some 12,000. The oldest parts of the town have many beautiful and historic buildings. The town grew rapidly during the Second World War and still has army, navy and airforce bases nearby. Over the last ten years the town has grown rapidly again with the building of new housing estates and a light industrial trading estate. There is a pedestrian precinct for everyday shopping and an increasing number of specialist shops in the High Street.
